Le gouvernement français est en train de mettre en place un plan pour booster le secteur du tourisme français, particulièrement à l'approche des Jeux olympiques de Paris en 2024. Le Premier ministre a effectué un voyage à Angers ce jeudi pour participer au comité interministériel du tourisme, où les décisions clés pour l'avenir du secteur ont été prises. Selon les informations disponibles, le gouvernement compte sur l'augmentation des recettes du tourisme pour contribuer à la relance de l'économie française. Cependant, le secteur est encore confronté à des défis considérables, notamment la concurrence à l'échelle internationale, les restrictions sanitaires et la crise économique mondiale. L'objectif du gouvernement est d'attirer plus de touristes à la France, particulièrement à l'approche des Jeux olympiques, qui sont attendus pour leur impact positif sur l'image de la France à l'échelle mondiale. Le Premier ministre espère que les recettes du tourisme augmenteront grâce à cette opportunité unique. Les décisions prises lors du comité interministériel du tourisme concernent principalement la promotion de la France comme destination touristique, l'amélioration de l'accueil des visiteurs et la mise en place de nouvelles infrastructures touristiques. Des mesures spécifiques pour attirer les touristes étrangers sont également prévues. Grâce à ces efforts, le gouvernement espère que le secteur du tourisme français connaîtra une rebondissement significatif, ce qui contribuera à la relance de l'économie française. Cependant, il est trop tôt pour prédire avec certitude les résultats de ces efforts.

In a joint statement at the conclusion of the 2025 European Central Bank (ECB) annual meeting, ECB President Christine Lagarde and Member of the Executive Board Philip Lane highlighted the importance of navigating the complex economic landscape that lies ahead. Lagarde expressed her optimism regarding the EU economy's resilience, stating that 'despite the uncertain global backdrop, our projections suggest that the euro area economy will continue to expand at a moderate pace'. However, she also cautioned that economic growth is still heavily reliant on the ongoing recovery of the EU's manufacturing sector, which remains under pressure due to supply chain disruptions and energy price shocks. Lane echoed Lagarde's sentiments, pointing to the need for the ECB to remain vigilant in the face of rising inflation pressures. He emphasized the need for a flexible monetary policy response to mitigate the impact of external shocks on the euro area economy. In their joint statement, Lagarde and Lane also highlighted the ECB's commitment to its price stability mandate, citing the need for a sustained period of low and stable inflation to support economic growth and investment. The ECB's policymakers have been keen to stress that their inflation targeting framework remains unchanged, with a medium-term goal of keeping inflation below but close to 2% inflation rate. With the global economic outlook facing increasing uncertainty, Lagarde and Lane's statement serves as a timely reminder of the need for policymakers to remain agile and responsive in the face of a rapidly changing economic environment.

Economists Gather at IJCB Research Conference to Assess Monetary Policy's Impact Amid Pandemic At the recent "Assessing the Effectiveness of Monetary Policy during and after the COVID-19 Pandemic" conference hosted by the Czech National Bank and the International Journal of Central Banking, some of the world's leading economic minds came together to examine the effects of monetary policy in the face of the ongoing pandemic. Keynote speaker, Professor Jane Smith, of Harvard University, outlined a comprehensive overview of how monetary policy was utilized worldwide to combat the economic downturn brought about by the crisis. According to her presentation, interest rates were lowered significantly, and unprecedented amounts of liquidity were injected into financial systems to shore up confidence and stimulate economic growth. One of the most pressing questions posed by Professor Smith was how monetary policy's effectiveness varied across regions and economies, with the European Central Bank (ECB) using negative interest rates to stimulate borrowing in the eurozone, while the US Federal Reserve implemented quantitative easing measures to inject liquidity into its financial markets. Another prominent economist, Dr. Tom Johnson, from the University of Oxford, suggested that monetary policy's impact may have been overstated, with fiscal policy playing a more significant role in the recovery process. He pointed out that government spending and tax cuts played a crucial role in stimulating economic growth in many countries. The conference marked a significant milestone in the global economic community's efforts to understand the complex interplay between monetary policy and economic recovery in the post-pandemic era. As the world continues to navigate the uncertain economic landscape, these findings will be crucial in shaping policymakers' decisions and guiding the global economic agenda.

Bonjour, je voudrais partager avec vous une stratégie de couverture spécifique qui pourrait être mise en œuvre pour minimiser les risques dans le marché actuel en utilisant l'ETF SPDR S&P 500 Trust. Dans le contexte actuel, la volatilité élevée des marchés boursiers et la menace d'une récession mondiale font que les options sont devenues une partie essentielle des stratégies de gestion des risques. Pour cette raison, je propose de mettre en place une stratégie de couverture basée sur des options pour protéger le portefeuille des pertes potentielles. La stratégie que je suggère consiste à acheter des options calls avec une date d'échéance à court terme pour les indices S&P 500. Cette approche permettra de bénéficier des gains potentiels si le marché se révèle être plus fort que prévu, tout en limitant les pertes si le marché recule. Nous allons également mettre en place une position de couverture pour le cas où les prix se maintiendraient à des niveaux élevés en utilisant des options puts. En effet, les options puts nous permettent de protéger notre portefeuille en cas de baisse des prix, en nous permettant de vendre les actifs à un prix fixe. Pour ce faire, nous allons acheter 10 options calls avec une date d'échéance à 30 jours pour une quantité de 100 actions de l'ETF SPDR S&P 500 Trust, avec un prix d'exercice de 370. Cela nous permettra de profiter du potentiel de croissance du marché S&P 500 tout en minimisant les risques de perte. Nous allons également acheter 20 options puts avec une date d'échéance à 30 jours

Bonjour, aujourd'hui je voulais partager avec vous quelques perspectives de Keith Gangl, portefeuille gestionnaire chez Gradient Investments, qui a récemment participé à l'émission "Power Lunch" de CNBC. Keith Gangl a partagé ses analyses sur plusieurs entreprises, et il est important de noter que ses remarques sont basées sur ses observations à ce jour. Tout d'abord, il a souligné l'intérêt qu'il porte à l'industrie automobile, notamment en ce qui concerne les entreprises de mobilité électrique. Selon lui, ces entreprises ont une grande opportunité de croissance, notamment face à la transition vers une économie de plus en plus verte. D'autre part, Keith Gangl a également mentionné que certaines entreprises sont sous-évaluées, telles que les sociétés de télécommunications. Il pense que ces entreprises ont un potentiel de croissance significatif, malgré les défis qu'elles rencontrent actuellement. De plus, Keith Gangl a également partagé son point de vue sur l'industrie financière, notamment en ce qui concerne les banques. Selon lui, ces institutions ont un rôle crucial à jouer dans l'économie, mais elles doivent également adapter leurs stratégies pour rester compétitives. Enfin, il est important de noter que les perspectives de Keith Gangl sont basées sur ses observations à ce jour et qu'il est toujours important de faire ses propres recherches avant de prendre des décisions d'investissement. Cependant, ses remarques peuvent fournir une vision intéressante sur les tendances économiques actuelles et les opportunités d'investissement qui s'en suivent.

La crise alimentaire mondiale : un facteur déterminant de la vague migratoire La production agricole en déclin et la concurrence accrue pour les ressources limitées ont provoqué une augmentation de la faim dans le monde, faisant de celle-ci l'un des principaux moteurs de la vague migratoire mondiale. Les dirigeants politiques doivent prendre des mesures urgentes pour répondre à cette situation critique. Selon les estimations de l'Organisation des Nations Unies pour l'alimentation et l'agriculture (FAO), plus d'un milliard de personnes souffrent chaque jour de la faim ou de la malnutrition. Cette situation est particulièrement préoccupante dans les régions les plus pauvres et les plus vulnérables, où la production agricole est déjà fragile et où les ressources sont limitées. La concurrence pour les ressources alimentaires est de plus en plus acharnée, particulièrement dans les zones où les populations sont en croissance rapide. Les échanges commerciaux et les prix des denrées alimentaires varient considérablement, rendant difficile la planification des besoins alimentaires des communautés. La faim et la malnutrition ont des conséquences graves pour la santé, notamment la mortalité infantile, la maladie et la mortalité. Les migrations forcées et les mouvements de population sont souvent le résultat direct de la faim et de la pénurie d'aliments. Les migrants sont souvent des femmes, des enfants et des personnes âgées qui sont les plus vulnérables à la pauvreté et aux conflits sociaux. Les pays-hôtes doivent s'adapter à une plus grande pression sur leurs infrastructures, leurs ressources et leur économie. Les dirigeants politiques doivent prendre des mesures immé

Marketmakers are being put under the microscope like never before as regulators and investors alike subject them to an unprecedented level of scrutiny. This intensifying scrutiny comes at a time when market structure is undergoing significant changes, with the rise of electronic trading and the proliferation of high-frequency trading firms. At the heart of the issue is the question of whether marketmakers are doing their job. Marketmakers are responsible for providing liquidity to the market by buying and selling securities, but many have accused them of failing to do so in recent years. The lack of liquidity has been a major concern, particularly in times of market stress when investors need access to cash quickly. Regulators are taking a closer look at marketmakers' activities, using tools such as market data analysis and trading simulations to assess their performance. In the US, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has launched a probe into the activities of several major marketmakers, including Nasdaq and Citadel. The scrutiny is not limited to regulators. Investors are also taking a closer look at marketmakers, using data analytics and other tools to assess their performance. The growing trend towards passive investing has also led to a decline in marketmaker revenue, as more investors opt for index funds and other low-cost investment options. The combination of increased regulatory scrutiny and investor skepticism is putting pressure on marketmakers to adapt and improve their performance. Those that fail to do so may find themselves facing significant challenges in the years ahead, as the market continues to evolve and change. The industry is at a crossroads, and marketmakers must demonstrate that they can provide the liquidity and stability that investors demand.

As we navigate the complex landscape of economic endeavors, it becomes increasingly clear that the battle to reduce risk has been at the forefront of centuries of ventures. From ancient traders to modern-day investors, the quest for minimizing uncertainty has remained a constant thread throughout history. In the early days of commerce, merchants and traders relied on rudimentary methods of risk assessment, such as geographical knowledge and social connections, to mitigate potential losses. However, as trade routes expanded and global markets evolved, so too did the sophistication of risk management strategies. The development of insurance, for example, allowed companies and individuals to transfer risk to specialized entities, thereby reducing the impact of unexpected events. Meanwhile, advances in finance and accounting enabled businesses to better manage their cash flows, making it easier to weather economic downturns. In modern times, the battle to reduce risk has become an increasingly data-driven endeavor. With the aid of sophisticated statistical models and machine learning algorithms, companies can now identify and mitigate potential risks with greater precision. This has led to the emergence of new risk management techniques, such as derivatives and hedge funds, which allow investors to hedge against market fluctuations. Despite these advances, the battle to reduce risk remains an ongoing challenge. As global markets continue to evolve and new risks emerge, businesses and investors must remain vigilant and adaptable in order to stay ahead of the curve. By embracing innovation and leveraging the latest tools and techniques, we can navigate the complexities of the modern economy with greater confidence, ultimately reducing the risk of failure and unlocking new opportunities for growth.

Ladies and gentlemen, esteemed guests, and fellow economic scholars, today I'd like to discuss a notion that has been at the forefront of international relations and global economics for centuries: the concept of hegemons and their responsibilities towards smaller nations. The term 'hegemon' refers to a dominant power that exerts significant influence over other countries, often through economic or military means. Historically, it's been common for hegemons to view smaller countries as mere pawns or obstacles to be sidestepped in pursuit of their own interests. However, this narrow-minded approach can have far-reaching consequences, destabilizing global markets and undermining the very fabric of international cooperation. As our world becomes increasingly interconnected, the actions of even the smallest countries can have a ripple effect on the global economy. The notion that 'size matters' when it comes to economic influence is being challenged by the rapid growth of emerging markets and the increasing importance of non-state actors. As a result, hegemons would do well to adopt a more nuanced approach, recognizing that even the 'puny' countries can play a significant role in shaping the global economy. By engaging in constructive dialogue, fostering cooperation, and promoting economic development, hegemons can create a more stable and prosperous world for all. In reality, neglecting smaller countries can lead to unintended consequences, such as the rise of non-state actors, trade wars, and the proliferation of protectionist policies. On the other hand, a more inclusive and collaborative approach can lead to greater economic growth, increased stability, and a more favorable business environment. In conclusion, hegemons would be wise to recognize the value of even the smallest countries and work towards creating a more inclusive and equitable global economy. By doing so, they can build a more stable and prosperous world for all, where every nation has the opportunity to thrive.

Elon Musk's Electric Vehicle Empire Hit Hard by Tariffs and US Policy Shift In a move that sends shockwaves through the global electric vehicle industry, Tesla, Elon Musk's flagship company, has reported a significant decline in profits due to a perfect storm of rising tariffs and a dramatic cut in US government support for the sector. The beleaguered EV manufacturer cited the escalating trade tensions between the US and China as a major contributor to its plummeting bottom line, with tariffs imposed on imported components and finished cars severely impacting its margins. The US government's decision to scale back subsidies for electric vehicles has also dealt a crushing blow to Tesla's sales and revenue projections. The move has led to increased competition in the market, as manufacturers such as General Motors and Ford have been able to undercut the struggling EV pioneer on price without the burden of government support. As a result, Tesla has been forced to hike prices across its model range, further eroding consumer demand and driving sales down. The news has sent Tesla's stock plummeting, wiping out hundreds of millions of dollars in market value in a single trading session. The company's prospects for a successful entry into the lucrative Chinese market have also been dealt a significant blow, as the ongoing trade tensions have made it increasingly difficult to navigate the complex regulatory landscape. With the EV sector facing unprecedented headwinds, analysts are now questioning whether Tesla can weather the storm and emerge as a dominant player in the market.

Ladies and gentlemen, esteemed members of the Oireachtas Select Committee on Budgetary Oversight, I'm honored to present before you today as the Deputy Governor of the Central Bank of Ireland. As we convene in the midst of a dynamic economic landscape, I'd like to offer a concise yet comprehensive assessment of the current state of our economy and our forward-looking projections. Our economic indicators suggest a robust growth trajectory, with the Irish economy poised to experience moderate expansion in the coming quarters. Underpinned by a resilient labor market, sustained consumer spending, and continued investment, our GDP growth forecasts remain optimistic, albeit tempered by global headwinds. The Central Bank of Ireland's latest Quarterly Bulletin underscores the need for prudence, cautioning against the pitfalls of overly exuberant economic expectations. As we navigate the intricate landscape of post-pandemic recovery and ongoing European and global policy shifts, our primary focus remains on preserving financial stability, ensuring prudent monetary policy, and safeguarding the integrity of our financial system. We continue to monitor the evolving economic landscape, adapting our policy responses as needed to maintain the delicate balance between economic growth and financial resilience. The Central Bank of Ireland remains committed to its three key objectives: maintaining price stability, supporting financial stability, and contributing to the safety and soundness of the financial system. We will continue to engage with you, the members of this committee, as we collectively strive to shape the Irish economy's trajectory, foster sustainable growth, and promote the well-being of all Irish citizens.

La SNCF a entamé la première moitié de l'année 2025 sur une note positive, enregistrant un résultat net sans précédent. Selon les dernières informations disponibles, le groupe ferroviaire a vu son résultat net quadrupler, passant d'un chiffre de millions à un chiffre de milliards. Ce regain de réussite s'explique principalement par deux facteurs clés : la fréquentation record de ses trains et l'amélioration de la rentabilité de SNCF Réseau. Des milliers de passagers ont choisi le train comme moyen de transport préféré, entraînant une augmentation des recettes pour la SNCF. Cette hausse de la demande est attribuée à divers facteurs, notamment à la montée en puissance de la concurrence et au développement d'offres de services de qualité. En outre, la SNCF a mis en place de nouvelles lignes et des horaires de passage plus réguliers, ce qui a attiré les voyageurs. D'un autre côté, SNCF Réseau a réalisé des progrès significatifs en termes de rentabilité. Cette filiale de la SNCF a optimisé ses opérations et réduit les coûts, ce qui a contribué à l'amélioration de ses résultats. L'entreprise a également investi dans l'automatisation de ses processus et la modernisation de ses infrastructures, ce qui a permis de réduire les temps de maintenance et d'améliorer la fiabilité du réseau. La combinaison de ces facteurs a permis à la SNCF de réaliser un résultat net exceptionnel au premier semestre 2025. Cette performance est attendue de poursuivre dans la deuxième moitié de l'année, avec l'arrivée de nouveaux trains et la

Government Boosts Renewable Energy Incentives with Guaranteed Price Hike In a move aimed at accelerating the transition to clean energy, the government has announced an increase in the maximum price it will guarantee wind farm developers for electricity generated from their projects. The new price cap, which takes effect immediately, will see a significant boost in the revenue wind farm operators can expect to earn from their turbines. Under the revised policy, developers will now be able to sell electricity to the national grid at a maximum guaranteed price of £60 per megawatt hour, up from £40 per MWh. The move is expected to attract fresh investments in the wind energy sector, particularly in regions with high transmission costs or limited grid connectivity. Industry analysts hailed the decision as a welcome shot in the arm for the sector, which has faced mounting challenges in recent years due to grid constraints and declining project returns. "This is a major boost for the wind industry, which has been struggling to make headway in an increasingly competitive market," said a spokesperson for the Renewable Energy Association. The government claims that the move will support the development of at least 2,500 new wind turbines over the next five years, enough to power over 1 million homes. However, some critics have raised concerns that the increased incentives will add to household energy bills and distort the market. As the UK continues its push towards net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, the wind energy sector is set to play a vital role in meeting renewable energy targets. With this latest boost, investors and developers are likely to take another look at the UK's wind energy market, which could lead to a significant increase in new project developments in the coming years.

Ladies and gentlemen, esteemed colleagues, and honored guests, I am pleased to present to you our latest press release survey on the access to finance of enterprises, highlighting the impact of trade tensions on interest rates. Our research findings reveal a significant shift in the landscape of borrowing costs for businesses, as firms continue to report declining interest rates on bank loans. According to our survey, the average interest rate on bank loans has decreased by 0.5 percentage points over the past quarter, reaching 6.2 percent. This decline is a welcome respite for businesses, particularly in the face of increasing trade tensions that have imposed significant pressures on the global economy. Trade tensions have led to a surge in uncertainty and volatility, making it more challenging for businesses to secure financing at competitive rates. However, our survey suggests that banks have adjusted their lending strategies to mitigate these risks, resulting in lower interest rates for firms. The decline in interest rates is particularly evident in the manufacturing sector, where firms have reported a 0.7 percentage point decrease in borrowing costs over the past quarter. This reduction is expected to boost economic growth, as businesses will have more liquidity to invest in expansion plans and capital expenditures. Our survey also indicates that firms are more optimistic about their access to finance, with 75 percent of respondents reporting that they have an adequate or better access to credit. This uptick in confidence is a positive indicator of the overall health of the economy. In conclusion, our survey findings suggest that the easing of interest rates has provided businesses with a much-needed breather, allowing them to cope with the pressures arising from trade tensions. As the global economy navigates these uncertain times, it is essential to closely monitor interest rates and their impact on businesses.

Le secteur de l'énergie a connu un sous-performance par rapport au marché général, mais il existe un nom qui verse des dividendes et qui est en pleine forme ces derniers temps. Après avoir perdu de la valeur au cours des années précédentes, les actions du secteur de l'énergie ont récemment retrouvé leur dynamisme. Et l'un des principaux bénéficiaires de cette tendance est un groupe qui verse des dividendes à ses actionnaires. Ce groupe, qui est spécialisé dans l'exploration et la production de pétrole et de gaz, a connu une série de découvertes de gisements importants dans les derniers mois. Ces découvertes ont permis au groupe de renforcer sa position dans le marché et de renflouer ses réserves. Mais ce qui fait vraiment briller ce groupe, c'est sa stratégie de gestion des dividendes. En effet, le groupe a décidé de verser un dividende trimestriel à ses actionnaires, ce qui a permis de stabiliser la valeur des actions. Et malgré les fluctuations du marché, le dividende du groupe a continué à augmenter au fil des trimestres. Ce qui rend ce groupe intéressant pour les investisseurs, c'est qu'il offre une opportunité de rentabilité stable et régulière. En effet, les dividendes sont payés de manière régulière et sont indexés à l'inflation, ce qui signifie que les actionnaires peuvent profiter de l'inflation sans prendre de risque. Mais ce groupe n'est pas sans risque. La volatilité des prix du pétrole et du gaz peut affecter la rentabilité du groupe, et les décisions de la direction peuvent également impacter la valeur des actions. Cependant, pour les investisseurs à la recherche d'une

Cloud Computing's Rise to Prominence: A New Era in Business As the digital landscape continues to shift and evolve, one trend has been gaining significant traction - cloud computing. According to Sundeep Gantori, a strategist at UBS, cloud adoption has experienced an unprecedented surge in recent years. In his interview with CNBC, Gantori noted that a year ago, cloud computing was a relatively small concept, but today it has grown to a point where it cannot be ignored. The exponential growth of cloud adoption can be attributed to the increasing demand for scalability, flexibility, and cost-effectiveness in business operations. Cloud computing has enabled companies to easily scale up or down depending on their needs, without the burden of expensive hardware and maintenance costs. This shift has not only saved businesses significant amounts of money but has also improved their agility and competitiveness in the market. The rise of cloud computing has also led to the emergence of new business models and revenue streams. With the help of cloud-based platforms, companies can now offer subscription-based services, software as a service (SaaS), and infrastructure as a service (IaaS), creating new opportunities for growth and expansion. While the growth of cloud computing is undeniable, there are also concerns about security, data sovereignty, and vendor lock-in. As more companies migrate to the cloud, they must carefully evaluate their options and consider the long-term implications of their decisions. Nevertheless, the trend is clear - cloud computing is here to stay, and its impact on the business world will be profound. As Gantori noted, it's a trend that cannot be ignored, and companies must adapt to the changing landscape to stay ahead of the competition.

Ladies and gentlemen, as we navigate the current economic landscape, it is essential to acknowledge the prevailing high interest rates. While this environment may seem challenging for investors and businesses alike, I firmly believe that it also presents opportunities for those who are willing to seize them. In a market characterized by high interest rates, bargains can indeed be found. One of the primary reasons for this is that high interest rates tend to slow down economic activity, which in turn leads to a decrease in asset prices. This decrease in prices can create a buying opportunity for those who are willing to invest in undervalued assets. For instance, in the bond market, higher interest rates can lead to a decline in bond prices, making them more attractive to investors who are seeking yields. Furthermore, high interest rates can also lead to a decrease in corporate spending, which can result in a decline in stock prices. This decline in stock prices can create buying opportunities for investors who are willing to take on a level of risk. However, it is essential to note that investing in undervalued assets is a high-risk, high-reward strategy, and investors should approach it with caution. In conclusion, at a time of high interest rates, there are indeed bargains to be found. Investors and businesses should be willing to take a closer look at undervalued assets and carefully consider the risks and rewards associated with them. By doing so, they may be able to capitalize on the opportunities that high interest rates present.

Un accord commercial historique entre les États-Unis et l'Union européenne est sur le point d'être signé, promettant une nouvelle ère de libre-échange entre les deux géants économiques. Selon les récents échanges diplomatiques, cet accord est attendu pour réduire les tarifs sur les biens et accroître l'accès au marché pour les deux pays. Selon les analystes économiques, cette nouvelle entente commerciale pourrait avoir des conséquences significatives sur les économies de la région. Les entreprises américaines bénéficieraient d'un accès plus facile au marché européen, notamment en ce qui concerne les exportations de produits manufacturés et agricoles. En retour, les entreprises européennes pourraient accéder plus facilement au marché américain, ce qui pourrait stimuler la croissance économique et la création d'emplois. Les réductions de tarifs pourraient également inciter les entreprises à investir davantage dans les deux pays, ce qui pourrait avoir un impact positif sur l'innovation et la croissance économique. De plus, cet accord pourrait faciliter la libre circulation des biens et des services entre les deux pays, ce qui pourrait conduire à une augmentation des échanges commerciaux et à une réduction des coûts logistiques. Cependant, il est important de noter que cet accord n'est pas sans controverse. Certains secteurs, tels que l'agriculture et l'industrie manufacturière, pourraient être touchés de manière négative par l'augmentation de l'importation de produits concurrents. Les gouvernements des deux pays devront donc veiller à ce que l'accord soit équilibré et bénéfique à l'ensemble de la population. En attendant, les analystes économ

Ladies and gentlemen, esteemed colleagues, honored guests, it is my pleasure to welcome you all to the ECB Forum on Central Banking, Adapting to Change, Macro Economic Stability. As we gather here today, I am reminded of the ever-evolving landscape of our global economy, where uncertainty and change are constants that we must confront head-on. As central bankers, we have a critical role to play in navigating these challenges, ensuring the stability of our financial systems, and fostering sustainable economic growth. But we cannot do this in isolation. We must engage with the broader community of experts, policymakers, and thought leaders to stay ahead of the curve and identify the most effective strategies for our work. Tonight, we begin a rich and thought-provoking discussion on the key issues that will shape our future. From digitalization and climate change to global trade and technological disruption, we will delve into the complex interplay of these factors and their implications for central banking. Over the next two days, we will draw on the expertise of our speakers and panelists, as well as the insights and experiences of our participants. We will explore the lessons learned from past success and failure, and identify the best practices and forward-looking strategies for addressing these new challenges. As President of the ECB, I am committed to using this forum as a platform to stimulate debate, foster collaboration, and promote knowledge-sharing. I invite you to join me in this endeavor, to share your perspectives, challenge our assumptions, and inspire new thinking. Together, let us harness the power of collective knowledge and expertise to ensure the resilience of our economic systems and the prosperity of our citizens.

A group of traders is taking their fight to the highest court in the land, as they have decided to appeal a regulatory decision that has left them reeling. This move comes on the heels of two significant victories for traders in the Supreme Court, which has emboldened the traders to pursue their case. The traders, who have been at the center of a heated debate over regulatory oversight, are seeking to reverse a decision made by a lower court that has been deemed too restrictive. The decision in question has been seen as a major blow to the traders, who argue that it unfairly limits their ability to operate in the market. The victory of two other traders in the Supreme Court has given the group renewed hope that they too may be able to overturn the decision. Those previous victories have set an important precedent, and the traders believe that their case shares similar characteristics. In a statement, the traders expressed their commitment to fighting for their rights and challenging what they see as an overly burdensome regulatory environment. They argue that the decision in question has stifled their ability to operate effectively, and has had a negative impact on the market as a whole. The Supreme Court has yet to announce a date for the hearing, but the traders are confident that they will be able to present their case effectively. With the previous victories serving as a guide, they believe that they have a strong chance of overturning the decision and securing the freedom to operate as they see fit. As the case makes its way through the courts, one thing is clear: the fate of the traders hangs in the balance. Will the Supreme Court side with the traders, or will the decision stand? Only time will tell.

L'industrie du tourisme est en pleine expansion mondiale, et les pays s'efforcent de se démarquer par leur attrait pour les voyageurs. Mais malgré sa réputation de pays le plus visité au monde, la France n'est actuellement que quatrième en termes de recettes touristiques. C'est un constat qui peut surprendre, car la France est synonyme de beauté, d'histoire et de culture. En 2024, les pays qui vont probablement surpasser la France en termes de recettes touristiques sont les États-Unis, la Chine et le Japon. Les États-Unis avec leurs parcs à thème, leurs montagnes russes et leurs villes vibrantes attirent les millions de touristes chaque année. La Chine quant à elle, avec son immense marché et ses richesses culturelles, est devenue un paradis pour les acheteurs et les curieux. Le Japon, avec ses villes modernes et ses traditions ancestrales, est également une destination très prisée. Mais comment la France peut-elle améliorer sa position ? Tout d'abord, il faut mettre l'accent sur la qualité de l'accueil. Les touristes ont besoin d'une expérience qui les dépasse, et la France doit s'efforcer de proposer des services de qualité pour attirer et fidéliser les visiteurs. Ensuite, il faut promouvoir les destinations moins fréquentées, pour éviter la saturation des lieux les plus touristiques. Enfin, la France doit se concentrer sur la diversité de ses attractions, pour offrir un mélange de culture, d'histoire et de nature. En résumé, la France a besoin de se réinventer pour rester compétitive dans l'industrie du tourisme.

Honorable members of the committee, I am Piero Cipollone, member of the executive board of the European Central Bank, and I am pleased to address you today on a matter of utmost importance for the future of our monetary union and the European economy: the digital euro. As we all know, the digital age has brought about profound changes in the way we live, work, and interact with each other. The rise of digital payments, online transactions, and mobile money has transformed the landscape of our economy, making it more interconnected, more efficient, and more inclusive. However, this shift has also raised questions about the role of traditional currencies in this new landscape. In this context, the European Central Bank has been exploring the possibility of launching a digital euro, a digital version of the euro that would coexist with cash and traditional electronic payment systems. A digital euro would be a secure, user-friendly, and widely accessible means of payment, available to all citizens, businesses, and institutions in the euro area. The introduction of a digital euro would have far-reaching implications for the European economy, from promoting financial inclusion and reducing barriers to cross-border payments, to enhancing the efficiency and resilience of our financial system. It would also provide a safe and reliable alternative to private digital currencies, ensuring that the euro remains a strong and stable currency in the digital age. In the following discussion, I will elaborate on the benefits and challenges associated with the digital euro, and outline the ECB's plans for its introduction. I look forward to your questions and comments, and to a fruitful exchange of views on this critical matter for the future of our monetary union.

Ladies and gentlemen of the Economic Club of New York, it is an honor to be here today to discuss the current state of the global economy. As we navigate a world increasingly intertwined by technological advancements, shifting global dynamics, and economic uncertainty, it is imperative that we critically examine the factors influencing our economic trajectory. We are witnessing a period of unprecedented technological growth, with automation and artificial intelligence poised to revolutionize industries and alter the nature of work. While these advancements offer boundless opportunities for productivity gains and economic expansion, they also raise pressing concerns regarding job displacement, skill obsolescence, and social inequality. Furthermore, we are observing a significant shift in global economic power, with emerging markets rising to become major drivers of growth. China's ascent to the second-largest economy in the world, coupled with India's rapid industrialization, has redefined the global economic landscape. However, we must not underestimate the challenges that lie ahead. Rising protectionism, trade tensions, and geopolitical instability threaten to undermine the global economy's fragile equilibrium. The increasing debt levels, particularly in the developed world, and the pressing need for sustainable investment in infrastructure and education, further underscore the urgency of addressing these issues. As we move forward, it is crucial that policymakers, business leaders, and civil society come together to foster a more inclusive, resilient, and adaptable economic system. One that not only harnesses the benefits of technological progress but also mitigates its risks. We must prioritize education and re-skilling initiatives, invest in infrastructure and research, and promote open trade and dialogue to ensure a brighter future for all.

Bonjour à tous, aujourd'hui je voulais discuter d'un événement économique récent qui a suscité beaucoup d'intérêt, notamment au cours de la visite du président Trump. Les tensions entre le président et le président de la Réserve fédérale étaient à leur comble lors de cette occasion. Les relations entre le président et la Fed sont essentielles pour la stabilité économique d'un pays. La Fed a pour mandat de gérer la politique monétaire, tandis que le président est chargé de la politique économique globale. Cependant, ces deux institutions ont des objectifs différents et des approches distinctes. Lors de la visite du président Trump, il a critiqué la politique monétaire de la Fed, affirmant que celle-ci était trop restrictive et nuirait à la croissance économique. En retour, la présidente de la Fed a défendu sa politique, arguant que celle-ci était nécessaire pour maintenir l'inflation sous contrôle et stabiliser le système financier. Ces tensions sont un signe de l'importance de la relation entre le président et la Fed. Elles soulignent la nécessité d'une coordination étroite entre ces deux institutions pour garantir la stabilité économique et la croissance durable. Il est intéressant de noter que ces tensions ne sont pas nouvelles. Les relations entre le président et la Fed ont déjà été tendues à l'occasion dans le passé. Cependant, l'ampleur actuelle de ces tensions souligne la complexité de la situation économique actuelle et la nécessité d'une réponse claire et cohérente. En conclusion, les tensions entre le président et la Fed sont un sujet de préoccupation majeur pour la stabilité économique du pays. Il est essentiel que ces deux institutions travaillent ensemble pour trouver des solutions

As big food firms continue to phase out artificial colours from their products, a new opportunity has emerged in the tech industry to fill the gap. Tech companies are rushing to develop sustainable, plant-based alternatives to artificial colours, which are used in a wide range of food products, from brightly coloured candies to vibrant fruit juices. The trend towards natural ingredients is driven by changing consumer preferences and growing regulatory pressure on food manufacturers. In response, major food companies such as General Mills and Kraft Heinz have announced plans to eliminate artificial colours from their products in the coming years. This shift is expected to create a significant demand for alternative colouring agents, which is being met by tech firms. One of the key players in this space is a start-up called Colour Sciences, which has developed a range of plant-based colouring agents made from natural ingredients such as beets, turmeric, and annatto. The company's products are already being used by major food manufacturers and are seen as a more sustainable alternative to artificial colours. Other tech firms, including biotech companies and material scientists, are also working on developing new colouring agents using microorganisms, algae, and other natural sources. These innovations have the potential to not only provide a sustainable alternative to artificial colours but also to create new products and applications in the food industry. The development of natural colouring agents is not only driven by consumer demand but also by regulatory pressures. In the European Union, for example, food manufacturers are required to label products containing artificial colours, which can be a major marketing hurdle. As a result, companies are looking for alternative solutions that are not only more sustainable but also more appealing to consumers.

Bonjour à tous, je suis ravi de partager avec vous aujourd'hui la stratégie monétaire de la Banque Centrale Européenne, en tant que membre du directoire de la BCE. Notre objectif principal est de maintenir la stabilité financière et économique en zone euro, en veillant à ce que l'inflation reste à 2% et en soutenant la croissance économique. Actuellement, nous nous trouvons face à une situation économique complexe. La croissance économique de la zone euro est encore modeste, les taux d'inflation sont en baisse et les risques géopolitiques sont importants. Cependant, nous constatons également que l'économie mondiale est en train de se rééquilibrer, avec une croissance plus forte en Asie et en Amérique latine. Face à ces défis, notre stratégie monétaire est orientée vers la stabilité et la prévisibilité. Nous avons récemment abaisser nos taux d'intérêt pour soutenir la croissance économique et nous continuerons à surveiller attentivement les tendances économiques pour ajuster notre politique monétaire en conséquence. Je voudrais également souligner l'importance des progrès réalisés en matière de réformes structurelles dans la zone euro. Les efforts déployés par les gouvernements pour améliorer la croissance et la compétitivité de leurs économies sont importants pour renforcer la résilience de la zone euro. En conclusion, notre stratégie monétaire est axée sur la stabilité, la prévisibilité et la croissance économique à long terme. Nous sommes convaincus que la coopération et la concertation entre les pays de la zone euro sont essentielles pour

Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas, it's always a pleasure to be here in Texas, a state that's synonymous with economic growth and resilience. As we continue to navigate the complexities of our current economic landscape, I want to take a moment to address some of the key issues that are on our minds. One of the most pressing concerns is inflation. We've seen a steady uptick in prices over the past year, and it's clear that the Fed has its work cut out for it in terms of keeping inflation under control. But I'd like to suggest that this isn't just a problem of monetary policy, it's also a question of global supply chains and the shift towards a more sustainable economy. We're seeing companies invest heavily in renewable energy and more efficient production methods, which is great news for the environment. However, it also means that we're facing potential shortages and bottlenecks in certain sectors. This is where the Fed comes in – we need to be thinking about how to mitigate these risks and ensure that our economy remains resilient in the face of change. Another area that's been on my mind lately is the growing wealth gap. We've seen incredible growth in the US economy over the past decade, but it's clear that not everyone is benefiting from it. This is a problem that requires a coordinated effort from policymakers, businesses, and individuals. We need to be thinking about how to create more opportunities for people to get ahead, and how to address the systemic inequalities that are holding us back. Ultimately, the Fed's job is to ensure price stability and maximum employment. But in a world that's increasingly complex and interconnected, we need to be thinking about how to address the broader economic challenges that are facing us. We need to be agile, adaptable, and committed to using our tools to promote growth and stability.

Ladies and gentlemen, I'd like to address the current market landscape. Yesterday's performance by the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite hitting fresh all-time highs was a testament to the ongoing resilience of these indices. As we head into Tuesday, investors are likely to be focused on the upcoming earnings season, particularly in the tech sector. The market's reaction to tech earnings will undoubtedly be a key area of interest this week. With many of the industry's leading players set to report their quarterly results, investors will be eager to gauge the trajectory of the sector. As such, we can expect a heightened level of scrutiny and market volatility surrounding these releases. In terms of specific stocks, Alphabet, Amazon, and Meta Platforms are among the notable names set to report their earnings. Each of these companies has had a significant impact on the market and will likely attract considerable attention from investors. Looking ahead to the day's trading, we can anticipate a busy session with market participants seeking to position themselves ahead of the earnings releases. The Federal Reserve's upcoming policy decision will also continue to influence market sentiment, with many investors closely watching the central bank's stance on monetary policy. As we navigate this complex market environment, it's essential to stay informed and adapt to changing circumstances. With the earnings season in full swing, CNBC will provide comprehensive coverage and analysis to help investors make informed decisions.

La concentration des richesses dans les mains de quelques-uns menace la viabilité économique mondiale. Selon le rapport annuel sur la richesse mondiale, cette tendance ne faiblit pas. Les chiffres sont alarmants : un million de millionnaires en plus en un an, ce qui signifie que la plus grande partie de la richesse mondiale est concentrée dans les mains de 1 % de la population. En d'autres termes, 99 % de la population mondiale ne possède que 1 % des actifs. Les causes sous-jacentes à cette inégalité sont complexes et multifacettes. Mais une chose est claire : les politiques économiques actuelles, qui privilégient la croissance financière plutôt que la justice sociale, contribuent à creuser ces écarts. Les taux d'intérêt bas et les mesures de stimulation économique ont permis aux entreprises et aux individus les plus riches de se trouver de nouvelles opportunités de spéculation et d'accumulation de richesse. Cependant, cette situation est non seulement inéquitable, mais également économiquement insoutenable. Les riches sont ceux qui bénéficient le plus des politiques économiques actuelles, mais ils ne contribuent pas aux dépenses publiques, ce qui entraîne des défaillances des services publics et de l'infrastructure. Par ailleurs, les individus les plus pauvres, qui sont déjà vulnérables aux chocs économiques, sont encore plus affectés par les fluctuations du marché. La situation est donc délicate : les politiques économiques actuelles favorisent la concentration des richesses, mais elles sont en même temps la cause de problèmes économiques et sociaux plus larges. La question est de savoir comment équilibrer la création de richesse et la justice sociale

Bonjour à tous, je voudrais discuter avec vous d'un phénomène intéressant qui nous concerne directement dans le secteur du tourisme. Les professionnels du secteur estiment qu'il y a actuellement un "double effet JO" cet été, qui a des conséquences importantes sur notre activité. D'une part, les Jeux Olympiques de Paris ont suscité une grande attente et une forte curiosité autour de la capitale. Les médias ont fait découvrir notre ville à un public international, et cela a attiré des touristes qui avaient toujours rêvé de visiter Paris. Ces visiteurs veulent découvrir l'atmosphère sportive, les infrastructures de qualité et l'accueil chaleureux que nous réservons aux touristes. D'autre part, les Jeux ont également eu un effet de "report" sur les touristes qui avaient prévu de venir en été, mais qui ont reporté leur visite en raison de la pandémie ou pour d'autres raisons. Maintenant qu'ils ont vu la belle image que nous avons faite pendant les Jeux, ils veulent enfin découvrir notre ville et ses atouts. Ces deux facteurs se combinent pour créer un "double effet JO" qui nous offre des opportunités exceptionnelles. Mais cela nous oblige également à être prêts à accueillir un flux important de visiteurs, à répondre à leurs attentes et à garantir leur satisfaction. En tant que professionnels du tourisme, nous devons être à la hauteur de cette opportunité. Nous devons nous assurer que nos infrastructures sont en mesure de supporter le flux de visiteurs, que nos services sont de qualité et que nous offrons à nos clients une expérience inoubliable. C'est un défi, mais nous sommes confiants dans nos capacités à le rele

Le Premier ministre a décidé de sillonner la France pour relancer l'économie, notamment le secteur du tourisme qui, selon lui, a besoin d'un petit boost. Ce jeudi 24 juillet, c'est la région des Pays de la Loire qui a bénéficié de sa présence, lors d'un comité interministériel tenu à Angers. L'objectif est clair : augmenter les recettes du tourisme, un secteur en pleine croissance depuis les Jeux olympiques de Paris, qui ont créé une ferveur inédite autour des lieux de passage des athlètes. Le Premier ministre espère que cette dynamique va se maintenir au-delà des jeux, pour faire de la France un véritable leader mondial du tourisme. Mais pour y parvenir, des mesures concrètes sont nécessaires. Selon les sources gouvernementales, cela signifie entre autres la mise en place de nouvelles infrastructures touristiques, comme des aéroports modernisés et des hôtels de luxe. De plus, le gouvernement a décidé de booster la promotion de la France à l'étranger, pour attirer encore plus de visiteurs. Il est à noter que les économistes estiment que le tourisme représente désormais plus de 7% du PIB français, un chiffre considérable. Ainsi, le Premier ministre a-t-il raison de donner la priorité à ce secteur pour stimuler l'économie. Mais les défis sont également nombreux, notamment la concurrence féroce qu'il va devoir affronter des destinations comme l'Italie ou l'Espagne. En attendant, la région des Pays de la Loire va bénéficier de ces investissements, avec pour objectif de devenir un véritable
